intro: Eumachia ramisulca, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eumachia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. Eumachia ramisulca is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
